summary: A letter from the UK Metropolitan Police's Deputy Assistant Commissioner to US Attorney Geoffrey Berman, providing the contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor in relation to the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The letter references prior contact by US Embassy representatives in London.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the letter, leading the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the US investigation referenced in the case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein' for allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Referred to as the client of the solicitor whose contact details are being provided to the US investigation.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.context: Solicitor for Prince Andrew, whose firm and contact details are provided by the Metropolitan Police.

connections.description: Gary Bloxsome is identified as the solicitor for Prince Andrew.
Berman is the US Attorney leading the prosecution against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Metropolitan Police Letter to US Attorney
events.description: The Metropolitan Police in London sends a letter to US Attorney Geoffrey Berman providing the contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor, in connection with the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: New Scotland Yard, 1-8 Richmond Terrace, Victoria Embankment, London SW1A 2JL
keyFacts: The UK Metropolitan Police provided the contact details for Prince Andrew's solicitor, Gary Bloxsome of Blackfords LLP, to the US investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
US Embassy representatives in London had previously contacted the Metropolitan Police on behalf of the US investigation to request these contact details.
The document confirms official coordination between US and UK authorities regarding the Epstein investigation as of December 2019.
The investigation referenced is United States v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), concerning allegations of sexual exploitation and abuse.
